name: Create Patient
description:
Creates a Patient resource on the server and returns it in the response. If the patient already exists, it is returned instead. If the CPR number does not match a patient on the service, looks up the CPR in the national registry and finds any potential prior CPRs used by the person. If a prior CPR number matches a patient on the service, returns a a patient with the query-CPR number and data from the service. If the CPR is invalid, i.e. does not correspond to a patient on the national registry, it errors. 

### Note
This operation is currently the only way to create Patient resources in the eHealth Infrastructure, as it ensures that the correct bindings from national registers
comment: See the wiki for examples on how to use the operation.

parameter.name: crn
parameter.documentation: The social security number of the person on which this operation is executed.

parameter.name: return
parameter.documentation: The Patient resource that has been created on the server or an already created patient
